column1: == History ==
The name Ewell derives from Old English æwell
column2: which means river source or spring.

column1: Bronze Age remains have been found in Ewell and the Romans are likely to have encountered an existing religious site when they first arrived leaving pottery
column2: bones
column4: which have been taken to the British Museum. Ewell is on a long line of spring line settlements founded along the foot of hills on a geological line between the chalk of the North Downs to the south
column5: and the clay of the London Basin to the north.

column1: The Roman road Stane Street from Chichester deviates from straight slightly at Ewell to pass by the central spring. Its successor
column2: the A24 (London Road) runs from Merton to Ewell along the course of the Roman road
column3: and leaves Ewell also with a by-pass connecting it to Epsom.Ewell lay within the Copthorne hundred.

column1: == Neighbourhoods ==
=== Ewell Court ===
Ewell Court is a residential area and ward to the northwest of Ewell Village. In the centre of the area is Ewell Court Park
column2: which contains Ewell Court House and Ewell Court Lake. The volunteer-run Ewell Court Library is inside Ewell Court House. A large portion of The Hogsmill Open Space
column3: a local nature reserve is in this area
column4: from the railway line near Ewell Village to Ruxley Lane. This contains several tributaries of the Hogsmill River
column5: including the confluence with the Horton Stream near Ruxley Lane. Ewell Court is bounded to the northeast by the A240 (Kingston Road).

column1: === West Ewell ===
West Ewell is a large residential area with several local centres. Its main centre is the area around Ewell West railway station
column2: which contains a parade of shops. Its largest roads are Chessington Road and Ruxley Lane. These are both B-roads which contain several parades of shops. A section of the Hogsmill Open Space
column3: including the Bonesgate Stream is in the northern fringes of the area. Ruxley Farm Bridge is in the centre of Ruxley Lane over the Hogsmill River
column5: Ruxley Splash. West Ewell is served by buses travelling between Epsom and Kingston

== In art ==

Pre-Raphaelite artist William Holman Hunt married and produced several artistically and conceptually outstanding works here.  The doorway linking St Mary's church yard and the grounds of Glyn House reproduced as the door on which Christ is knocking is arguably his most praised painting
column2: The Light of the World.

column1: Similarly
column2: the background for John Everett Millais' oil on canvas Ophelia was painted at Ewell.
